page.title: 16A CONVERTED CHURCH AT STIBB
page.content: The small{church}at Stibb was built in 1882 for the{Church of England.}Cannon Thynne, who was vicar of the parish church at Kilkhampton,built it for nuns while they ran an{orphanage.}The nuns departed during World War 1 and parishoners had to attend church at Kilkhampton.In 1975 the church was finally closed. Rev. Watts, who had conducted the services there from 1958 to 1975, decided to buy it for conversion to a house for his own retirement.The walls are made of local quarried stone and are 53 cms. thick. In the church there is a large original{stained-glass {window}which Rev. Watts has retained. Although it is a home now, it is still recognisable as a{chapel}at the cross-roads in the hamlet.
